job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates business needs into testable functional logic, requiring 4+ years of experience in SaaS/AI systems and strong collaboration skills.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes, enforcing security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong networking knowledge (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • Experience in SOC operations or SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation as a Senior DevSecOps Engineer, ensuring secure cloud environments and fostering a security-first culture across engineering teams.

Location: SBC No.2304, 3rd Floor, Yamuna Building, Technopark Phase III, Trivandrum, Kerala, 695583 Website: https://www.feathersoft.com Closing Date: 30, Jan 2026 Published Date: 30, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@feathersoft.com

Job Title: Data Analyst

Brief Description We are seeking a Data Analyst with 1–2 years of hands-on experience in Power BI and SQL. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in both tools, along with a solid understanding of data analytics, reporting, and business intelligence.

Responsibilities:

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets.
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
  • Collaborate with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • 1–2 years of experience in Power BI
  • 1–2 years of hands-on experience in SQL
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • MBA graduates are preferred for their strong background in statistics and business analysis
  • Familiarity with any of the following tools/platforms:
  • Tableau
  • Databricks
  • Python
  • AWS Data Environments
  • Azure Data Environments

Preferred Skills:

  • Power BI
  • SQL
  • Dax Measures
summary: Data Analyst role requiring 1–2 years of Power BI and SQL experience, focusing on data analysis, reporting, and business intelligence. MBA graduates preferred for statistical and business analysis expertise.

job_description:
LEADER IT (P) Ltd

Address: SBC 1, -2 FLOOR, THEJASWINI BUILDING, PHASE 1, TECHNOPARK CAMPUS, KARYAVATTOM P O, TRIVANDRUM, KERALA , 695581

Website: www.leaderit.in

AI Developer - Python (Remote)

Closing Date: 07, Jan 2026 Job Published: 30, Dec 2025 Contact Email: jobsindia@leadergroup.com

APPLY HERE >> AI Developer

Position Overview

Develop robust Python-based AI applications and end-to-end Machine Learning pipelines. Focus on training, fine-tuning, and deploying open-source models (Hugging Face) and Deep Learning solutions, while leveraging Generative AI and Agents to enhance system capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Python Application Development: Write clean, efficient, and scalable Python code for backend logic and data processing pipelines.
  • ML & DL Model Lifecycle: Design, train, and validate Machine Learning and Deep Learning models (Regression, Classification, NLP, Computer Vision) using standard frameworks.
  • Open Source Deployment: Select, fine-tune, and deploy open-source models from Hugging Face into production environments.
  • Gen AI & Agents: Implement Generative AI features (LLM integration) and Agentic workflows where they add specific value to the product.
  • API & Serving: Build high-performance APIs (FastAPI/Flask) to expose ML/DL models and AI agents to front-end systems.
  • Optimization: Optimize model inference for latency and resource usage; ensure code quality through testing and CI/CD practices.

Required Qualifications

  • Expertise in Python programming (Data Structures, Algorithms, OOP).
  • Strong foundation in Machine Learning (Scikit-learn) and Deep Learning (PyTorch/TensorFlow).
  • Hands-on experience deploying Hugging Face Transformers and managing open-source model pipelines.
  • Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs (FastAPI/Flask/Django).
  • Practical knowledge of Generative AI (RAG, basic Agentic patterns) and LLM APIs.
  • Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and cloud deployment (AWS/GCP).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, AI, or related field.
  • Experience with model quantization and optimization techniques (TensorRT).
  • Minimum 3 years relevant experience

Preferred Skills

Python, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Hugging Face Transformers, scikit-learn, API Development, FastAPI, Generative AI, RAG, Docker, Git, SQL, Model Deployment, MLOps
summary: Develop Python-based AI applications and deploy ML/DL models using frameworks like PyTorch/TensorFlow. Requires 3–4 years of experience in Generative AI, API development, and cloud deployment.
